H0.text: Day is the time period on Earth during which two high tides and two low tides occur.

H1.text: Hour is the interval after which two high tides and two low tides occur on Earth.

H2.text: A week is the period during which Earth experiences two high tides and two low tides.

H3.text: Month is the period in which two high tides and two low tides occur on Earth.

A4.text: Ocean tides are cyclic, rising and falling approximately twice a day.

A5.text: Many shorelines experience semi-diurnal tidesâ€”two nearly equal high and low tides each day.
